title: The Dragon Girl
opening: After saving the hidden village of Arcadia, Roy's army found their way out of
Now they turned toward Etruria to confront the Coup d'etat forces.  At this
point, a disturbing message came from the Elder of Arcadia.
Apparently, Fa, the little Dragon girl, had left Arcadia, following Roy.  If
she were to fall into the hands of the Coup d'etat forces or of Bern, who stood
behind them, it would be a disaster.
Bent on finding Fa, Roy moved his forces toward a small fort near the Etrurian

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: General Raeth, about the girl we captured earlier...

intro.speaker: Raeth
intro.line: Girl? That one that was scurrying around the outskirts of the castle? Are you still worrying yourself over that thing? Just throw her out.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: But sir, she was carrying this.

intro.speaker: Raeth
intro.line: ? Is this...a Dragon Stone?

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: ...That is also what I thought, so I decided to report.

intro.speaker: Raeth
intro.line: Have you ever seen a Dragon Stone before?

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Yes, when we invaded Lycia. The Dragons were carrying them when they were in their human form.

intro.speaker: Raeth
intro.line: ...But it looks different from the ones that they have. Either way, it has to do with the Dragons. We should inform King Zephiel and follow his instructions. Make sure the girl doesn’t get away!

intro.speaker: Douglas
intro.line: Percival, don’t strain yourself here.

intro.speaker: Percival
intro.line: Lord Douglas, please do not worry about me. You must return to King Mordred’s side.

intro.speaker: Douglas
intro.line: Hmph, defeating the Lycia Alliance Army is not a task that requires the Knight General’s assistance. ...Roartz, that snake.

intro.speaker: Percival
intro.line: He is wary of my turning against him. He must be thinking that I would try and murder him in his sleep if I were stationed at Aquleia.

intro.speaker: Douglas
intro.line: That man, worrying about traitors? Ha! He shouldn’t be the one to talk. Why, he was first to betray his loyalty to the king! The bastard.

intro.speaker: Percival
intro.line: Well, Lord Douglas, it just goes to show that not many have such loyalty as you.

intro.speaker: Douglas
intro.line: Rubbish. Look at yourself.

intro.speaker: Percival
intro.line: ...I had no hesitations when Prince Mildain was alive. I never doubted my loyalty to him, or to the wellbeing of Etruria. This mission is to protect the king’s life... That...should be enough reason to fight...

intro.speaker: Douglas
intro.line: Do you hesitate now?

intro.speaker: Percival
intro.line: Yes, slightly. But it matters not. Nothing will change even if I do.

intro.speaker: Douglas
intro.line: I see... Percival, my speech from this point forth is merely to myself. Do not reply to it.

intro.speaker: Douglas
intro.line: Etruria...will most certainly fall with the king before this war ends.

intro.speaker: Percival
intro.line: !! Lord Douglas!?

intro.speaker: Douglas
intro.line: Listen! No matter what happens, I will stay by the king’s side. But you, Percival, you are different. You are the one who will lead Etruria’s future. I cannot say when, but I firmly believe that Etruria will be blessed with prosperity once more. So Percival, you must leave Etruria and wait until that time comes.

intro.speaker: Percival
intro.line: Lord Douglas! What does...

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: General Percival! We have spotted the Lycia Alliance Army up ahead! What are your orders, sir?

intro.speaker: Douglas
intro.line: Now go! I shall return to Aquleia.

intro.speaker: Percival
intro.line: ... Move forth! Pursue the Lycia Alliance Army!

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Is that the castle where Fa was taken?

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Yes. The locals have witnessed it.

intro.speaker: Igrene
intro.line: Roy, I apologize on behalf of my people for the inconvenience... I know we must hurry toward Aquleia.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: No, please don’t worry about it. If she were to fall into the hands of Bern, that in itself would be a disaster.

intro.speaker: Igrene
intro.line: She should be safe as long as she remains in her human form and doesn’t show anyone her Dragon Stone.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Dragon Stone?

intro.speaker: Igrene
intro.line: Yes. When Dragons are in their human form, they seal their powers into crystals called Dragon Stones. It is said that it takes vast amounts of energy for Dragons to maintain their actual form in this world, so they typically remain in human form to minimize energy consumption.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Maybe the ‘human not human’ was in human form for the same reason.

intro.speaker: Igrene
intro.line: Most likely. It is also said that Dragons only started taking human after the Scouring ended.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Since the Scouring...?

intro.speaker: Igrene
intro.line: Yes...

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Master Roy, the spy we sent to the castle has returned.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: What did he find out?

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: He said that a large number of troops have been coming out of the castle. They seem to be fortifying their defenses.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Oh... Maybe they found out that Fa is a Dragon.

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: The border guards also seem to have noticed us...

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: We have to do this quickly.

battle.speaker: Garret
battle.line: This is gonna be a battlefield, too...

battle.speaker: Garret
battle.line: The army’s gonna loot the villages anyway. I suppose we better ransack ’em while we can.

battle.speaker: Garret
battle.line: But make sure you don’t do any unnecessary killing, you got that?

battle.speaker: Bandit
battle.line: He’s too nice... Well, I guess we can make it the army’s fault.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: General Raeth, the reinforcements are ready!

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: Wait!

recruit-talk.speaker: Garret
recruit-talk.line: What? Who are you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: Why? Why do you attack the villages?

recruit-talk.speaker: Garret
recruit-talk.line: Eh? Who do you think you are?

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: Tell me why you’re attacking the villages!

recruit-talk.speaker: Garret
recruit-talk.line: Why? ...Well, I could say that it’s your fault.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: Our fault...?

recruit-talk.speaker: Garret
recruit-talk.line: Yup. Because you idiots are causing wars like this, there are more and more people like me who have to steal to get food.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: We are fighting to help people like that.

recruit-talk.speaker: Garret
recruit-talk.line: Right, I’ve heard that enough times now. Look at reality, kid. They all say that they’re trying to help, but it’s all words and empty promises. Where’s the action? You got your head in the clouds, and you just can’t see what goes on on the ground. Get it? Now out of my way.

recruit-talk.speaker: Garret
recruit-talk.line: What!? Listen, I ain’t playing games with you. If you don’t get the hell out of my way...

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: I won’t move. If you want to kill me, then you may do as you wish.

recruit-talk.speaker: Garret
recruit-talk.line: What...

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: If I let you pass, I would just be another one of those people who you say are all talk and no action. I am telling the truth! We are fighting to help the people.

recruit-talk.speaker: Garret
recruit-talk.line: You... Hehe... I never thought I’d meet anyone so naive.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: Do you...laugh at us...?

recruit-talk.speaker: Garret
recruit-talk.line: But still, it’s nice to hear once in a while.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: Then...

recruit-talk.speaker: Garret
recruit-talk.line: All right, you win. I’ll stop looting. But you gotta let me fight with you guys. I gotta see with my own eyes that you’re gonna be true to your words.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: Thank you. If you fight alongside us, I’m sure you will understand.

recruit-talk.speaker: Garret
recruit-talk.line: Well, you certainly seem confident about that. I’m Garret. And you’re...

recruit-talk.speaker: Lilina
recruit-talk.line: Lilina.

recruit-talk.speaker: Garret
recruit-talk.line: Lilina? Well, then, I’m pleased to make your acquaintance, milady.

boss.speaker: Raeth
boss.line: Hmm… There must be a reason that you attack this castle… But what…?

boss.speaker: Raeth
boss.line: Gah…! That girl…she isn’t human, is she! Why…do you seek her…! To use her power…? …!

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Master Roy, here she is!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: You found her? All right, I’m coming!

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Now, young lady, thank Master Roy.

end.speaker: Fa
end.line: ...Sniff, sniff...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: It’s okay, Merlinus. ...Now, why did you follow us?

end.speaker: Fa
end.line: Fa just wanted to see the outside world...

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: What! For such a reason... Do you know how much trouble you have caused?

end.speaker: Fa
end.line: But...but... Fa’s never, ever allowed outside! The elders say that Fa has to be hidden... Fa is always all alone...all locked up in her room...

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Master Roy, what shall we do?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...You’ve suffered a lot. But do you understand that you’ve worried the elders and caused a lot of inconvenience?

end.speaker: Fa
end.line: Fa’s sorry...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Really sorry?

end.speaker: Fa
end.line: Yes.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Well, then, you can come with us.

end.speaker: Fa
end.line: Really!?

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Are you sure?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: The enemy might already know about her. In that case, it’s better to have her where we can see her rather than letting her go off on her own back to Arcadia.

end.speaker: Fa
end.line: Yay!

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Hush! Don’t get too excited.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: But you mustn’t go off alone anymore. Promise?

end.speaker: Fa
end.line: Yes! Fa promises!

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: General Percival, until further instructions are given, we will station ourselves in this castle and prepare for further attacks from the Revolutionaries.

end.speaker: Percival
end.line: Good.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Here, we found this in the castle. Please take it. General Percival, please take care...of Etruria.

end.speaker: Percival
end.line: I know. Leave it to me.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Yes!
